issue.body:
### Issue URL (Annoyance) [https://web.de/](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=https%3A%2F%2Fweb.de%2F) ### Comment Username: @Morku > This update notification is some kind fishing to install Firefox with bundled unwanted software. > > I am maintaining someones PC. When always a new Firefox is released, I have to fix his browser, because he has "Firefox for Web.de" installed. He has web.de as homepage. > Even when I tell him, that he doesn't care about updating his browser (it's enabled by default), he probably gets frighten by this Banner and installs it. If you don't carefully read, you get a modified browser. > > This Banner should be treated IMO like some sort of Smartbanner. Even if the purpose sounds good, it is for fishing unskilled users to have Scam installed. > > Install some sort outdated Firefox, e.g.: https://ftp.mozilla.org/pub/firefox/releases/116.0/win64/en-US/Firefox%20Setup%20116.0.exe > An User Agent with changed browserversion might also work. > > The same banner also appears on https://www.gmx.net/ , https://www.gmx.at/ and https://www.gmx.ch/ ### Screenshots

comment.body:
https://produkte.web.de/browser/firefox/#.hp.sichwarn.ff -> https://dl.web.de/browser/firefox/WEB.DE_Firefox_Stub_Installer.exe?check=mcsp

https://www.gmx.net/produkte/browser/firefox/#.hp.sichwarn.ff -> https://dl.gmx.net/browser/firefox/GMX_Firefox_Stub_Installer.exe?check=mcsp

Software should be always installed from developer homepage. It should not be maintained by a third party page. Users who disable automatic browserupdate usually "knows what they do". You get the Banner even if you don't use "Firefox for Web/GMX", just because you are in transition between the browserversion, when a new version is released and automatic update didn't install yet. The bundled software can be also installed from Mozilla Firefox Add-Ons, if needed.
So users who use AdGuard shouldn't be nagged by this banner.

Desktop

AdGuard URL Tracking filter

_No response_

Tracking parameters from the `Watch on YouTube` button on embeds.

`https://linustechtips.com/topic/1509706-goodbye-anthony-welcome-emily/`:
> `https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=b-owBhLGaH4&embeds_referring_euri=https%3A%2F%2Flinustechtips.com%2F&feature=emb_imp_woyt`

```adb
||youtube.com^$doc,removeparam=embeds_referring_euri
^feature=emb_imp_woyt^$domain=youtube.com,doc,removeparam=feature
```

issue.body:
### Issue URL (Incorrect Blocking) [https://quizlet.com/sign-up?signupOrigin=global-footer](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=https%3A%2F%2Fquizlet.com%2Fsign-up%3FsignupOrigin%3Dglobal-footer) ### Comment > With AdGuard turned on, the Quizlet website no longer loads the sign in or sign up page, and appears as if the button was not clicked at all, even if navigating to the direct URL of the sign in page. Therefore, it is not possible to sign in to Quizlet with AdGuard turned on. With AdGuard turned off, the sign in page loads quickly as a overlay that obscures whatever page was behind it. The cookie prompt also comes back, but that is not essential for sign in to work. ### Screenshots
